text:
Mary Elizabeth Truss (born 26 July 1975), known as Liz Truss, is a British politician. She is the Secretary of State for International Trade and President of the Board of Trade since July 2019 in Boris Johnson's cabinet. She was the the Chief Secretary to the Treasury from 2017 to 2019 and Member of Parliament (MP) for South West Norfolk since 2010. Truss was born in Oxford. She was educated at the University of Oxford.
She also served as the Secretary of State for Justice and Lord High Chancellor from 2016 to 2017, Secretary of State for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs from 2014 to 2016 and Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for Education and Childcare from 2012 to 2014.

annotations.surface_form: Secretary of State for International Trade
President of the Board of Trade
Secretary of State for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for Education and Childcare
